snippet: While opposition groups are mostly concentrating on ending the rule of President Bashar al-Assad, they are also positioning themselves for the question of who will rule after he is gone.
abstract: Syrian political opposition groups outside the country are concentrating on ending the rule of Pres Bashar al-Assad, but are also positioning themselves for the longer-term question of who will take charge in a post-Assad era.

byline.contributor: Hala Droubi contributed reporting from Istanbul, Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: While opposition groups are mostly concentrating on ending the rule of President Bashar al-Assad, they are also positioning themselves for the question of who will rule after he is gone.

headline.seo: From Abroad, Trying to Mold a Post-Assad Syria
headline.main: Trying to Mold a Post-Assad Syria From Abroad
headline.print_headline: Trying to Mold a Post-Assad Syria From Abroad

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
